snippet.textDisplay: Motorcycle segment? I held my DS up to someone else, and just mashed the swap characters button. It was awesome.

snippet.textDisplay: But that's the main point. Even though SoTN's tracks didn't use much accents and rock music, its incredible. I like all Portrait of Ruin's tracks, but yet, SoTN's are classic and yet rock. You should try out Lost Painting. Do you realize the difference between year 1797 and year 1944?? think about it yourself. Think about the gameplay sory plot background. You have your own point though, I understand it.
snippet.textOriginal: But that's the main point. Even though SoTN's tracks didn't use much accents and rock music, its incredible. snippet.textDisplay:
The same man behind the Wangan Midnight Maximum Tune soundtracks also did this song, as well as several other PoR songs. 

Yuzo Koshiro is by far one of my favorite game soundtrack composers, along with Michiru Yamane (who has composed CV soundtracks for some time now) and the guy behind the Cho Ren Sha 68K soundtrack (can't recall his exact name at the moment--Rusarin-something).
snippet.textOriginal:
The same man behind the Wangan Midnight Maximum Tune soundtracks also did this song, as well as several other PoR songs. 

Yuzo Koshiro is by far one of my favorite game soundtrack composers, along with Michiru Yamane (who has composed CV soundtracks for some time now) and the guy behind the Cho Ren Sha 68K soundtrack (can't recall his exact name at the moment--Rusarin-something).
